content: >http://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601124&sid=a7MNonvi.C5g&refer=home Two people in the US have fallen ill with a mysterious variety of Swine Flu. That's a concern because Swine Flu is a respiratory transmitter. And so is another illness that has killed 20 in Mexico. Nobody knows what it is, yet. Except it, too, is a 'breather'.

title: Diseases Break Out in US and Mexico

content: Mexico flu deaths raise fears of global epidemic Unique virus connected to cases in Calif. and Texas; source still a mystery Mexico shut down schools, museums, libraries and state-run theaters across its overcrowded capital Friday in hopes of containing a swine flu outbreak that authorities say killed at least 20 people — and perhaps dozens more. World health authorities worried openly that the strange new virus could become a global epidemic. The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said tests show some of the Mexico victims died from the same new strain of swine flu that sickened eight people in Texas and California. Of the 14 samples tested from Mexico, seven were matches, said the CDC's acting director Dr. Richard Besser. Mexico put the confirmed toll at 20 dead, but 40 other fatalities were being probed, and at least 943 nationwide were sick from the suspected flu, the health department said. Full story at >>>http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/30386163/

Full story at >>>http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/30386163/
title: Diseases Break Out in US and Mexico

content: >http://www.reuters.com/article/bondsNews/idUSN2445294320090425 Up to 100 dead Mexicans - all young adults. A thousand sick. 6 Americans ill now. 1 Canadian reported to 'have recovered'. Maybe the Gunny is onto something. CDC in the US and Canada are all over this. Interesting to see all those Mexicans on the news looking like the Chinese used to. Add this to the crash of Canadian tourist companies and I hope we start taking more passes on the Mayan Riviera. It may not be near Mexico City but it's only 3 hours away by truck or car, Mayans could make it there and back in a day. That leaves 6 to cough all over you. Disease can do more for border security than Ms Napolitano has ever dreamt of.

content: quote: Mexico flu deaths raise fears of global epidemic Aren't those called pandemics? epi vs. pan vs. end. They all have different reasons when dealing with a "demic". (sic) Global would be pandemic.

content: Man, the news on this is moving at a disturbingly face pace. Yesterday it was some obscure piece of the daily news, today I hear "OUTBREAK," "POSSIBLE PANDEMIC," and the sight of Mexicans covering up their faces is not reassuring....neither are the cases in various parts of the US and Canada. This thing is moving...
